messages.subject: Re :military homeschooling
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/24/2002 9:32:19 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... I m sure others will chime in with quotes, but if I m not mistaken... If you re military,
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/24/2002 9:32:19 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
> Doesn't the military have it's own homeschooling regulations? Maybe with
> variations from base to base? They don't adhere to the regulations in the
> state the base is in, do they?
>
I'm sure others will chime in with quotes, but if I'm not mistaken...

If you're military, you follow the laws of the state you're residing in.
There are exeptions for FOREIGN bases/posts: unschooling is illegal in
Germany, but US military may homeschool there (as well as go to DoD schools).
Americans living in Germany (NOT military) are subject to German law and may
not homeschool.

Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
